items.text: Ensure the component is responsive, flexible and is future proof. Think about all the places where it might be used, when and what for would designers use it, and design your new component accordingly.
Make sure you use styles from our foundations libraries when using colour, typography, spacing, etc. Ensuring brand alignment is key to preserve a high quality and consistent experience.

items.headingText: Use appropriate naming and supporting information
items.text: Assign it a name that is descriptive and identifiable, and add a component description in Figma. This will ensure your new component is easily discoverable and usable.
Outline all options for the component to ensure all use cases are covered. This will enhance the consistency of the component and set a standard for their use within products.
Define usage guidelines, document best practices, warn of common mistakes and describe how to correctly use the component in designs. This will help others understand how to use your new component.
